article.headline: Seattle U 88, Portland 85
article.story: PORTLAND, Ore. (AP) -- Bernard Seals scored 23 points as Division II Seattle overcame a double-digit deficit to beat Portland 88-85 on Wednesday. In most years, it would have been a shocking victory for Seattle to beat a Division I team. But the Redhawks beat Pacific 72-71 in an exhibition game on Nov. 5. Until then, Seattle had not beaten a Division I team since the 1979-80 season. Seattle (3-0) beat Portland on the strength of its outside shooting. Seals hit five 3-pointers and Sean Namanny added four. Portland (1-3), which had five players in double figures, including Marcus Lewis with 19, led almost the entire way and had a 61-50 lead with 12:50 left the game. The Redhawks, who made 56 percent of their shots in the second half, took their first lead at 77-75 when Sam Kirby scored on a drive with 3:40 left. After a three-pointer by Seals, Seattle's lead was 80-77. Portland sandwiched 3-pointers by Darren Cooper and Pooh Jeter around a three-point play by Seattle's David White to tie the game at 83 with 1:38 left. Seattle's Jeffrey McDaniel hit three free throws to give the Redhawks a lead they would not lose. Cooper missed a 3-pointer from just inside the midcourt line as time expired. White had 17 points for the Redhawks. Cooper, Kevin Field and Donald Wilson had 13 points each for the Pilots.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.
